text: Marilyn Hall (née Plottel; born May 17, 1927 – June 5, 2017) was a Canadian- born American television and theatre producer, as well as a television writer. She also wrote songs, a cookbook and book reviews. She supported many charities, including Jewish causes in the United States and Israel. She was an associate producer of Jelly's Last Jam and Angels in America: A Gay Fantasia on National Themes. On television, she produced the PBS version of The Ginger Tree as well as the 1984 movie Nadia.
